page.title: 13FARMING: GATESHEAD
page.content: The owner of{High House Farm,}Wardley has 132 acres of land, 126 arable and the remaining 6 meadowland. The farm only produces{wheat,}but at one time reared cattle. The two farm houses have been standing since the 1850's. {Modern machinery}includes a large tractor and a combine harvester. The busiest time of year is in August at harvesting time. Five other farms surround High House Farm, so most of the area is under cultivation. {Springwell Village}is surrounded by a narrow band of farmland. This land is for grazing beef cattle or for barley{production.} No cow's milk is produced but a small amount of goat's milk is. A few free range hens are kept and their eggs are sold in the village.
